title: Im Pretty Sure People Wanted 10 Bans Because They WANTED Certain Champs To Be Permabanned
body: 10 bans just filter out the champions with kits so overpowered or toxic that they don't even belong in league of legends. You had a chance to make the meta more diverse and instead its going to be 3 dominant champions for every role xd

replies.body: Yeah no shit. And Riot doesn't want their champs permabanned.

Then rework them, shift their power, do something.

Part of the reason people want crap like Lee permad is because, on the surface, it appears that Riot isn't interested in changing him regardless of how abhorrent he is to play against.

So what other choice do these people have?
this. If champion is permabaned that means someone doesent want to play with or against them at all . That tells you alot about that champion design.

It doesn't as you're literally saying that a person's choice of a permaban can never be subjective but is always objective in nature. That isn't true. I ban Yi because every Yi on my team i've played with so far has been a liability, no matter how good or bad he's been doing. 

That doesn't mean he's broken.
It just means i have had bad experience when playing with Yi players and i don't want him in my games. That doesn't mean Riot should change Yi in some way because he's on my permaban list.
Yes, but what if Yi was on the majority of people's permaban list, like Yasuo currently is?

Yasuo is also on my ban list for the same reason Yi is.
Enemy Yasuo does win his lane, does know to build crit and damage and shit on everyone, my Yasuo always loses their lane and goes centuries old bruiser build that doesn't work anymore.

I'm not banning Yasuo because he can't be countered.
And i'm not saying that Yasuo can't be on the usual banning list of the majority of players because he isn't absurdly strong. I'm just saying that every player has their own reason why someone is on their permaban list and most of the times, these champions are there because of the popular opinion. This means that players themselves don't understand why they're banning these champions, they merely adapt the ban list from pro play and use it as factual evidence that they are, in their current condition, too strong for the current meta.

If a champion is being banned in most of the games, then there definitely is a legitimate reason why they're being banned. But if you ask players themselves why do they ban what they ban, most of the times you're either going to get generic response (because they're OP/broken) or they wouldn't know how to properly answer your question. This only proves that these ban lists are most of the times adopted from higher ELOs and passed down to everyone else.

_**You know what you're supposed to be banning but you don't know exactly why you're doing it.**_

Maybe, but does that make it any less valid?

I'm honestly getting sick of the "get good" excuse.

The issue for a lot of these people IS NOT THAT THEY CANNOT FIGHT THESE CHAMPIONS.
It's that when they have to, THEY FUCKING HATE IT. 

Doesn't matter if I'm LCS or bronze 5, it will never change a champion's kit, and if someone think's it's obnoxious (notice I didn't say overpowered), THEN SKILL WILL NEVER MATTER.

Now this next bit is completely 100% opinion, so take it with a grain of salt (pun not intended), but frankly i think dismissing the feelings of not an individual, but a full group, off as "they are trash, get better" seems rather arrogant if you ask me.

I hate fighting Shen with a fiery passion, but the boards love that champ for some reason.  I have plenty of champs I'd love to never see again, but I'd never lobby for more bans in the hopes that those champs would become permabanned and then gutted. That's the difference between me and the yasuo/lee/fizz/etc. haters.

This. I hate fighting Gangplank, Yi, Shen, Galio, Nautilus, Maokai and Poppy. You don't see me posting shit about them on the boards everyday. Begging people to ban them for me. I jist need to get good.

why do you hate yi tho i don't get it
he's inexistent in early game which is why he isn't played in high elo
if you invade him/gank lanes before him, it's legit a free win

Comming from a Yi/Aatrox main.

A fed yi is extremely frustrating. Especially if he gets fed, he can dumpster your entire team for the simple mistake of using your cc before your damage spells. 

He isn't op, but his entire kit is ridiculously frustrating if ahead because of the amount of damage he can dish.

Yi mains also tend to be garbage people too, and that doesn't help.
Same thing is with Tryndamere tbh.
Tryndamere has arguably the biggest fuck you skill in the game.

If you consider plat or diamond high elo then you are totally wrong.

Hell, Lee is broken even in challenger.

Janna x Rubick is a master tier player and also can confirm nobody hates Yasuo and nobody bans him there either.

And I consistently watch the streams of 4 challenger players. Nobody bans him there either or even talks about him.

"Nobody".

Thats why he is the 8th most banned champion in Diamond+ when he isnt even one of the most OP ones. I also know several diamond and plat tier players and a lot of them hate yasuo.

I get that there are more players complaining about Yasuo in low elo than in high elo, but there are a lot of high elo players that do complain about him (the best known example that comes to mind was the challenger Dopa) and a lot of low elo players that dont (such as you). Generalizing in this case is a mistake.

You can find the Yasuo matchup as a cakewalk or as a cancer because some parts of his kit are insanely effective to deal with low mobility, low burst and/or skillshot/projectile reliant champions, while being useless otherwise. It doesnt have anything to do with the elo you play in, but with the champions you play.

Its kinda obvious that they wont ban him in challenger because they are almost forced to play meta champs and they only have 6 bans to deal with the OP champions, but that doesnt mean he is fun to play against.

The "Git gud" argument when it comes to Yasuo is absolute garbage. His kit is toxic in design. People don't complain about him being OP, they complain because "dash dash dash dash Q Q Q rinse repeat" is just horrible to play against.

It's horribleness decreases exponentially as you become a better laner. The only people that really have a right to complain about Yasuo are people who main mages with nothing but skillshots like Ziggs. And even then, Ziggs can handle himself if played correctly.

Again. The "git gud" argument you're constantly throwing around is worthless.

People know how to deal with Yasuo, they just don't want to lane against someone with double crit and no cooldown on his mobility and damage spell as well as a windwall that negates all skillshots thrown towards him. 

It's not that hard to understand when you dismount from that high horse.
